title: Notes by the Way; or, what I saw in my rambles
author: Higginson, H. Talbot.
snippet: persons, and is used for concerts, balls, exhibitions, &c.; it containsa fine organ, the gift of Mr. A. Mulholland, which cost £3,300. TheBelfast Gas Works contain one of the largest gasometers in the world,holding, when full, 2,600,000 cubic feet of gas. Belfast is the great depot of the linen and damask trade, and forspinning and weaving flax; also for Dunville's whiskey, and MarcusWard's illuminated cards, and Cantrell and Cochrane's ærated waters,which are supplied to most of the shipping companies.
